It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1793 Sep. 16, Knoxville, Tennessee [to] Colonel Daniel Kenedy, Greene County, Tennessee / John Sevier
bibl.author: Sevier, John
bibl.note: This document is a letter written in 1793 by John Sevier to Colonel Daniel Kenedy. Sevier complained that only half of the men from Greene County had shown up for for military service on the frontier. Sevier demanded Colonel Kenedy to send the other half of the troops.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: Only about the one half of the Quota of Militia of Greene County have appeared notwithstanding the urgent necessity for their being at this time on the frontier which appears liable to be over run and totally destroyed by the enemy. It gives me pain to think that the County of Greene so brave on all former occasions should be so slack at a time of such imminent danger_ You will therfore therefore please to send out without delay the remaining part of this number called for in my former order

closer.salute: I have the honor to be Sir Your obed. Hbl. Servt. obedient Humble Servant

div.p:
Public Service
Colonel Daniel Kenedy
Greene County
